channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The years old trench made up of several potholes which, not property mended, have joined up., 12th August
item.description:
On the left hand carriageway of Ermin Street, going from Green Street towards Golf Club Way. Highly visible, just in the right place to catch cyclists as well as drivers. Has been there for many years and reported several times; there have been Council claims that it has been fixed but hard to see why as it obviously has not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole exposing raised ironworks, 12th August
item.description:
On Hatp Hill at the End of Camp Road. Gl52 6PS.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown grass verge narrowing cycle path down to one lane, 12th August
item.description:
The cycle path from Shelburne Road to the junction of Hatherley Road is poorly maintained with overgrown grass verges narrowing the cycle path down making it difficult for cyclists to pass each other safely. There is damage to the tarmac surface from shallow pot holes and tree roots lifting the tarmac. As a result I have seen cyclists preferring to use the road as a safer option as travelling on the path there is the potential to be thrown off their bike or damage caused to their bike by all the bumps and loose gravel

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 12th August
item.description:
As you turn into humber place you will notice it. Cara are unable to avoid this due to park cars on side of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Humber Place, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branches down - 50m of path blocked, 12th August
item.description:
At least two very large branches have come down obstructing about 50m of the path. It is possible to walk through the field to bypass the debris, but it's quite a detour. I can forward details of the landowner if you want to remind them that they are responsible for clearing the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stump Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge Rail Support Post is broken, 12th August
item.description:
The rail support post on the right had side of the bridge as viewed in the photo, (Industrial Estate side), is rotten at the bottom and is in danger of collapsing, causing a safety issue for pedestrians crossing the bridge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Runnings, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole with water. Been repaired before but now a hole again. Water in hole even though it hasn’t rained., 12th August
item.description:
On the corner of the duel carriageway. Still not fixed properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees overhanging the road hindering the refuse lorries, 12th August
item.description:
Overheight trees obstructing the road at 4 New Road, Brockhampton. The recycing and rubbish lorries are struggling to access the lane. Property owner not available to discuss.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5 New Row, Park Lane, Sevenhampton, Cotswold
